lines.text: A reality is just what we tell each other it is.
Like the book?
I love it.
Good. Then this shouldn't come as a surprise.
This shit really sells doesn't it?
More than you'd think. Surprised?
Lady, nothing surprises me anymore. We fucked up the air, the water, we fucked up each other. Why don't we just finish the job by flushing our brains down the toilet?

[On hearing "It's Only Just Begun" playing while in his asylum cell]
Oh, no, not The Carpenters...
Did I ever tell you my favorite color was blue?
Reality is not what it used to be!
God's not supposed to be a hack horror writer.
Do you read Sutter Cane?
I can see.
Excuse me?
He sees you.
Great, uh... tell him I say hi.
I'm sorry about the balls! It was a lucky shot, that's all!

Every species can smell its own extinction. The last ones left won't have a pretty time with it. In ten years, maybe less, the human race will just be a bedtime story for their children. A myth, nothing more.

[about to commit suicide]
I have to, he wrote me this way.
I'm not insane, you hear me! I'M NOT INSANE!
I'm not if he's not!
Me neither!
I think, therefore you are.
Your books SUCK!
This book is going to drive people absolutely mad!
Well, let's hope so. The movie comes out next month.
A word of advice. You want to pull a scam, don't make your wife a partner. And if you do, don't fuck around behind her back.
This is a rotten way to end it.
This is not the ending. You haven't read it yet.
Never, Never, Never... throw chips at a driver.
You're waiting to hear about my 'them', aren't you?
Your what?
My 'them'. Every paranoid schizophrenic has one; a 'them', a 'they', an 'it'. And you want to hear about my 'them', don't you?
I want to know how you got here.
Things are turning to shit out there, aren't they?

[looking at Trent after beating a bum]
Do you want some too, buddy?
Why don't you try reading his stuff? See if you can get it.
Got any on tape?
You're my mommy. Know what today is? Today is Mommy's Day.

[to Dr. Wrenn]
Things must be getting pretty bad out there to bring you fellas in.

Trent]
Did he make any requests?
Just... one. A, uh... single black crayon.
There's a guard with a pair of swollen testicles who swears you wanted out of here.
Oh, Jesus, this place makes my head hurt.
